title: Oscar Klein and Gauge Theory
abstract: In this talk, delivered at the Oscar Klein Centenary Symposium in Stockholm, I review the 1938 conference held in Warsaw devoted to \lq \lq New Theories in Physics". I review all of the talks presented at this meeting and discuss in detail Klein's paper where he proposed a unified model of electromagnetism and the nuclear force that foreshadowed the later developments of non-Abelian gauge theories.
